name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Full Stack Web Developer
professional_summary: Utilized C# and .NET to build scalable web applications, ensuring seamless integration with React front-end components for enhanced user experience.
Developed RESTful APIs using .NET Core to facilitate communication between React front-end and SQL/MongoDB back-end systems.
Implemented React components with state management using Redux, improving application performance and user interaction.
Optimized database queries in SQL and MongoDB to enhance data retrieval speed and application efficiency.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to design and implement full-stack solutions, ensuring alignment with project requirements.
Integrated third-party APIs into React applications to extend functionality and improve user engagement.
Conducted code reviews and provided feedback to team members, ensuring adherence to coding standards and best practices.
Troubleshot and resolved front-end and back-end issues, ensuring minimal downtime and maintaining application stability.
Deployed applications to AWS cloud environments, ensuring scalability and reliability using AWS services like EC2 and RDS.
Implemented authentication and authorization mechanisms in .NET applications to ensure secure user access.
Developed and maintained documentation for full-stack applications, facilitating knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Participated in Agile ceremonies, contributing to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Refactored legacy codebases to improve maintainability and performance, reducing technical debt.
Implemented unit and integration tests for .NET and React components, ensuring code quality and reliability.
Worked with Docker to containerize applications, streamlining deployment processes and ensuring consistency across environments.
Utilized Git for version control, managing branches and pull requests to maintain a clean and organized codebase.
Engaged in continuous learning, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in full-stack development.
Mentored junior developers, providing guidance and support to enhance their skills and contribute effectively to projects.
